member.name: T:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils
member.summary: These are small examples problems for the .NET POP3 library

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.FetchAllMessages(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to fetch all messages from a POP3 server
member.param: Hostname of the server. For example: pop3.live.com
Host port to connect to. Normally: 110 for plain POP3, 995 for SSL POP3
Whether or not to use SSL to connect to server
Username of the user on the server
Password of the user on the server
member.returns: All Messages on the POP3 server

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.DeleteMessageByMessageId(OpenPop.Pop3.Pop3Client,System.String)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to delete fetch an emails headers only - how to delete a message from the server
member.param: A connected and authenticated Pop3Client from which to delete a message
A message ID of a message on the POP3 server. Is located in

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.FindPlainTextInMessage(OpenPop.Mime.Message)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to a find plain text version in a Message - how to save MessageParts to file
member.param: The message to examine for plain text

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.FindHtmlInMessage(OpenPop.Mime.Message)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to find a html version in a Message - how to save MessageParts to file
member.param: The message to examine for html

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.FindXmlInMessage(OpenPop.Mime.Message)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to find a MessagePart with a specified MediaType - how to get the body of a MessagePart as a string
member.param: The message to examine for xml

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.HeadersFromAndSubject(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to fetch only headers from a POP3 server - how to examine some of the headers - how to fetch a full message - how to find a specific attachment and save it to a file
member.param: Hostname of the server. For example: pop3.live.com
Host port to connect to. Normally: 110 for plain POP3, 995 for SSL POP3
Whether or not to use SSL to connect to server
Username of the user on the server
Password of the user on the server
The number of the message to examine. Must be in range [1, messageCount] where messageCount is the number of messages on the server.

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.DeleteMessageOnServer(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to delete a specific message from a server
member.param: Hostname of the server. For example: pop3.live.com
Host port to connect to. Normally: 110 for plain POP3, 995 for SSL POP3
Whether or not to use SSL to connect to server
Username of the user on the server
Password of the user on the server
The number of the message to delete. Must be in range [1, messageCount] where messageCount is the number of messages on the server.

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.FetchUnseenMessages(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Example showing: - how to use UID's (unique ID's) of messages from the POP3 server - how to download messages not seen before (notice that the POP3 protocol cannot see if a message has been read on the server before. Therefore the client need to maintain this state for itself)
member.param: Hostname of the server. For example: pop3.live.com
Host port to connect to. Normally: 110 for plain POP3, 995 for SSL POP3
Whether or not to use SSL to connect to server
Username of the user on the server
Password of the user on the server
List of UID's of all messages seen before. New message UID's will be added to the list. Consider using a HashSet if you are using >= 3.5 .NET
member.returns: A List of new Messages on the server

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.BypassSslCertificateCheck(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to set timeouts - how to override the SSL certificate checks with your own implementation
member.param: Hostname of the server. For example: pop3.live.com
Host port to connect to. Normally: 110 for plain POP3, 995 for SSL POP3
Read and write timeouts used by the Pop3Client

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.SaveAndLoadFullMessage(OpenPop.Mime.Message)
member.summary: Example showing: - how to save a message to a file - how to load a message from a file at a later point
member.param: The message to save and load at a later point
member.returns: The Message, but loaded from the file system

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.ChangeLogging
member.summary: Example showing: - How to change logging - How to implement your own logger

member.name: M:WebdriverFramework.Framework.Util.OpenPopUtils.InsertCustomEncodings(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Example showing: - How to provide custom Encoding class - How to use UTF8 as default Encoding
